mainHero.title: Innovate medical intelligence
mainHero.subtitle: NOVARA
mainHero.description: We help you design, validate, and deploy reliable machine-learning models with expert precision.

features.title: Key Features
features.subtitle: Why Choose Us
features.description: We provide comprehensive AI solutions tailored to your needs.

items.name: Scalable Infrastructure
items.description: Built to grow with your business.

items.title: Medical Analytics Solutions
items.description: We transform complex clinical and imaging data into clear, actionable insights to support diagnostics, clinical decision-making, and operational efficiency.

items.title: Deep Learning Modeling
items.description: We design, train, and optimize custom deep learning models—including computer vision, multimodal architectures, and predictive pipelines—tailored to your medical data and use case.

items.title: Actionable Insights from Clinical Data
items.description: We uncover clinically meaningful patterns from structured and unstructured datasets to guide treatment planning, trial design, and strategic decision-making.

items.title: Predictive Analytics
items.description: We develop prognostic models that forecast patient outcomes, treatment responses, and disease progression to support risk stratification and personalized medicine.

projects.title: Our Projects
projects.subtitle: Real-world applications of AI in healthcare and clinical research

items.title: Clinical Decision Support & Disease Prediction
items.description: We've developed AI tools to aid in faster, more accurate clinical decisions, from stroke and Parkinson's diagnosis to broader hospital applications. These systems aim to support clinicians in real-world care settings.

publishedPapers.title: Improved multi-site Parkinson's disease classification with counterfactual inference
Stroke Decision Support Systems for Clinical Practice

items.additionalInfo: Our AI-powered clinical decision support tools help clinicians make faster and more accurate diagnoses across multiple disease domains, with a particular focus on stroke and Parkinson's disease classification.

items.title: Causal & Counterfactual AI for Brain Imaging
items.description: Our research uses AI to explore "what if" scenarios in the brain, generating counterfactual images to understand how changes in brain structure relate to aging and disease. This approach makes predictions more interpretable and actionable.

publishedPapers.title: MACAW & MACAW 3D: Causal Generative Models for Brain Imaging
Generating high-resolution brain counterfactuals via autoencoders + causal flows
3D conditional diffusion for self-explainable brain age prediction

items.additionalInfo: By generating counterfactual brain images, we enable clinicians to visualize and understand how brain structures might change under different conditions, improving the interpretability of AI predictions.

items.title: In-Silico Modeling of Neurodegeneration
items.description: We have developed computational models of Alzheimer's and other dementia subtypes to study disease progression and support clinical decision-making. These in silico approaches enable exploration of disease dynamics and inform diagnosis and treatment planning.

publishedPapers.title: Towards realistic simulation of disease progression in visual cortex with CNNs
Digital dementia and testing cognitive interventions in degenerating networks

items.additionalInfo: Our computational models simulate disease progression in neurodegenerative conditions, allowing researchers and clinicians to test interventions and understand disease mechanisms in a controlled digital environment.

items.title: Spatial Transcriptomics & Systems Biology
items.description: We have developed computational models for gene regulatory networks in domains of stem cell differentiation and tumorigenesis.

publishedPapers.title: Emergence of diversity in homogeneous coupled Boolean networks
Critical dynamics in coupled Boolean networks with applications in pluripotent stem cells

items.additionalInfo: Our computational approaches model complex biological systems, from stem cell differentiation to cancer progression, providing insights into gene regulatory mechanisms and cellular behavior.

items.title: Evaluation of MR Acquisitions
items.description: We have performed quantitative and qualitative assessments of MR image sequences and acquisitions. Our research includes multi-modal imaging, automatic segmentation, and enhanced detection of brain features.

publishedPapers.title: Enhanced reader confidence for calcification vs. microbleed using QSM vs. SWI
Automatic image segmentation for multi-modal MR sequences

items.additionalInfo: Our work improves the accuracy and confidence of MR image interpretation through advanced sequence analysis and automated segmentation techniques, enabling better detection of subtle brain features.

items.title: Signal Processing in Brain Dynamics
items.description: Advanced signal processing techniques for analyzing brain dynamics and neural activity patterns.

publishedPapers.title: Signal Processing Methods for Brain Dynamics Analysis

items.additionalInfo: Our signal processing research focuses on extracting meaningful patterns from neural signals, contributing to a better understanding of brain function and dynamics.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.subtitle: Let's turn your clinical data into actionable intelligence
contact.description: Have a project in mind or want to explore how machine learning can support your research or clinical workflows? Reach out to us and our team will get back to you shortly.
contact.sampleMessage:
Hello,

I’m interested in learning more about your machine learning solutions for clinical data analysis. We would like to discuss a potential collaboration for predictive modelling and outcome analysis.

Please let us know a suitable time to connect.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Organisation]
[Contact Information]
